column3: Properly rebased (I missed one recent change in IsFinalTx, the `tx.nLockTime == 0` check).\n
Updated without touching the foreach loop as discussed on IRC.\nNow it's really really trivial... \n
Well, not exactly, the names are changed in #6183 and the consensus-unfriendly one doesn't take any parameters besides the transaction.\n

Closing after  #6183 has been  merged.\nBtw, @petertodd I think my last suggestion there (not using the activechain global from the new function CheckFinalTx) was a very reasonable nit, I'm a little bit dissapointed that you ignored it.\n
@jtimon Feel free to fix that nit anyway - but we just had to move ahead to get the bug fix in.\n

Yup, that's my thoughts here too.

However give me a week or so and I'll do up that median time patch design so we can fix this exactly once. On "vacation" right now. :)

> ahead to get the bug fix in.

nit: To avoid this declaration, would it not be possible to move the implementation of `CheckFinalTx()` (L661) above `isFinalTx()` (above L648)? IIRC we don't have function declarations in main.cpp.\n

This declaration will be necessary later anyway when the function is moved in https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/6769c02ca34303648de74f42c7dfd0cb1aaa41da#diff-cbe22f30d7e480617350ef6ceca97d0cR65 \nSo it's a temporary thing, and, yes, we have function declarations in main.cpp, for example, these two: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L81\nThe reason   to make it in t
